sect3.title: Overview

figure.title: Example for the Value invert filter

sect3.para:
This filter inverts Value (luminosity) of the active layer or selection. Hue and Saturation will not be affected, although the color will sometimes be slightly different because of round-off error. If you want to invert Hue and Saturation also, use
Colors Invert .

Note that hue and saturation can be distorted quite a bit when applying twice this filter for colors with a high luminosity (for instance, HSV 102°,100%, 98%, a bright green, gives HSV 96°, 100%, 2% after a first application of the filter, and 96°, 100%, 98% after a second application). Thus, you should not expect to be able to apply this filter twice in a row and get back the image you started with.

figure.title: Example of using this filter twice

caption.para: Second application: the image is not exactly the same as the original one.

sect3.title: Activating the Filter
sect3.para:
This filter is found in the main menu under
Colors Value Invert .
